places_to_visit.name: The British Museum
places_to_visit.description: The British Museum houses a vast collection of world art and artifacts, including the Rosetta Stone and the Elgin Marbles. It offers a deep dive into human history and culture.

places_to_visit.name: The Tower of London
places_to_visit.description: The Tower of London is a historic castle on the Thames River. It has served as a royal palace, prison, and treasury. Highlights include the Crown Jewels and the Yeoman Warders.

places_to_visit.name: Buckingham Palace
places_to_visit.description: Buckingham Palace is the official residence of the British monarch. Visitors can watch the Changing of the Guard ceremony and explore the State Rooms during summer openings.

places_to_visit.name: The Houses of Parliament and Big Ben
places_to_visit.description: The Houses of Parliament, also known as the Palace of Westminster, are the seat of the UK government. Big Ben, the clock tower, is an iconic symbol of London.

places_to_visit.name: The London Eye
places_to_visit.description: The London Eye is a giant Ferris wheel on the South Bank of the Thames. It offers panoramic views of the city and is a popular attraction for visitors.
